Axes

Item Creation Process: Crafting · Design · Fabrication · Materials · Production
Design Types: Tools · Clothing and Jewelery · Containers


Axes are comprised of a head and a handle. The category of Axes does include hammers, both as a combat skill and for purposes of crafting.

Contents

  • 1 Design Components
    • 1.1 Head
    • 1.2 Handle
    • 1.3 Optional
  • 2 Base Stats
    • 2.1 Axe
    • 2.2 Hammer

Design Components

An axe design requires at least one component for the Head and another for the Handle. One or more optional additions may be added.

Head

The design creation screen will have a toggle where a craftsman can choose to make the tool a hammer or leave it as a bladed object. Certain materials (IE; is a prefabricated blade) will set and lock this toggle if they are chosen for the head.


Handle

Optional

Base Stats

Axe

  • Heft equal the weight of the component materials.
  • Base Damage is one tenth Weight times ten percent of (101 minus the blade's Malleability).
  • Base skill bonuses are per materials used, plus XXX experience towards certain Carpenter or Farmer specializations.
  • Quality is 100%
  • Durability equal to ten percent of (100 minus Malleability).
  • Size in slots equal to the components.
  • Weapon reach in decimeters is equal to its length in slots, plus a meter.
  • Weight equals component's weight.

Hammer

  • Heft equal the weight of the component materials.
  • Base Damage is one tenth Weight times ten percent of (101 minus the blade's Malleability).
  • Base skill bonuses are per materials used, plus XXX experience towards Blacksmith or Carpenter.
  • Quality is 100%
  • Durability equal to ten percent of (100 minus Malleability).
  • Size in slots equal to the components.
  • Weapon reach in decimeters is equal to its length in slots, plus a meter.
  • Weight equals component's weight.
